body_html:
Hi @roostapour,

it looks like the binary receives a signal that kills it while it processes your data. I think the process-tools.c part of Bazel is just reporting that, though the logging could surely be improved here!

Could you please run your binary directly (not via bazel run) and see if it then works fine, or if it crashes at the same point in time?

It should work simply like this:

Step 1: Build

bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/models/rnn/translate:translate

Note that this prints the path to the binary after a successful build, like this:
____Building complete.
Target //tensorflow/models/rnn/translate:translate up-to-date:
bazel-bin/tensorflow/models/rnn/translate/translate

Step 2: Just run the binary from the path printed there:

bazel-bin/tensorflow/models/rnn/translate/translate --data_dir [your_data_directory] --train_dir [checkpoints_directory] --en_vocab_size=40000 --fr_vocab_size=40000

body:
Hi @roostapour,

it looks like the binary receives a signal that kills it while it processes your data. I think the process-tools.c part of Bazel is just reporting that, though the logging could surely be improved here!

Could you please run your binary directly (not via bazel run) and see if it then works fine, or if it crashes at the same point in time?

It should work simply like this:

 # Step 1: Build
bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/models/rnn/translate:translate

Note that this prints the path to the binary after a successful build, like this:
____Building complete.
Target //tensorflow/models/rnn/translate:translate up-to-date:
  bazel-bin/tensorflow/models/rnn/translate/translate

 # Step 2: Just run the binary from the path printed there:
bazel-bin/tensorflow/models/rnn/translate/translate --data_dir [your_data_directory] --train_dir [checkpoints_directory] --en_vocab_size=40000 --fr_vocab_size=40000
